Description: This is mostly just a giant compilation of companies where I saw UNCW students/alumni working.

Companies.Name: USAA
Companies.Location: Plano, Texas or San Antonio, Texas
Companies.Tips: The official name of this SWE position is "IT Intern". Set up notifications via handshake for USAA if you're interested. I think the San Antonio summer application comes out in early-mid September. The Plano one comes out in early-mid October. Apply as soon as the application comes out and I think your chances of getting the job will be pretty high. I could help you through the interview process, and if you did your internship in Plano I could help you with housing. You could also set job alerts using this link -> [Here](https://www.usaajobs.com/). Go to the bottom section of the page titled "Join our talent community" and enter your information to subscribe to their job alert mailing list. Also the return offer rate for full-time positions at USAA is VERY high (~85%) so keep that in mind through the process. This is a very fun, easy, low-stress internship with lots of great learning and networking opportunities. You'll meet a lot of other college kids in the same boat as you, which I think is good.

Companies.Name: Pearson
Companies.Tips: Usually Pearson appears at the UNCW Career fair, so apply there or beforehand online. Also it took around month after my interview to hear back so be patient.

Companies.Name: Datacor, Inc.
Companies.Contact: I know a guy. Email me if interested using the Contact Tab.
Companies.Tips: This is a remote position.

Companies.Name: H&R Block
Companies.Tips: I got this job through handshake, so set alerts there if you're interested.

Companies.Name: National Security Agency
Companies.Tips: Apply way before the job starts so you have enough time to get a security clearance. I went through basically the entire process so I can help you. Mine took roughly 3 months. Also I took like 3 months after I did the video interview to hear back and get an offer, so be patient. Also, UNCW seems to have some sort of connection with the @NSA and DoD@[{ 'name': 'ImageView', 'params': { 'Name': 'NSA Pic', 'Description': 'UNCW is designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CDE) by the National Security Agency and Department of Homeland Security. Link -> www.uncw.edu/ccde. (I took this picture in Congdon Hall)', 'Pic': 'NSA.png'} }].
Companies.Pay: The full-time SWE position offer I received paid $81,233 a year.

Companies.Name: Department Of Defense
Companies.Tips: Apply way before the job starts so you have enough time to get a security clearance. I went through basically the entire process so I can help you. Mine took roughly 3 months. Also, UNCW seems to have some sort of connection with the @NSA and DoD@[{ 'name': 'ImageView', 'params': { 'Name': 'NSA Pic', 'Description': 'UNCW is designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CDE) by the National Security Agency and Department of Homeland Security. Link -> www.uncw.edu/ccde. (I took this picture in Congdon Hall)', 'Pic': 'NSA.png'} }].

Companies.Name: Department Of State
Companies.Tips: Apply way before the job starts so you have enough time to get a security clearance. I went through basically the entire process so I can help you. Mine took roughly 3 months

Companies.Name: UNCW TAC Student Worker Technician
Companies.LinkedIn: Not Relevant, can't apply through LinkedIn.
Companies.Tips: TAC hires towards the end of the semester and you can apply on handshake. However, an easier way is to just email, "tachiring@uncw.edu" with your resume and class schedule. You don't need any technical background to perform this job and it's on campus. Note I've never had this job, but I know how the process works. I think this would be a great job to have while you're in school.
Companies.Pay: $12-$14 dollars an hour. You start at $12 and can work your way up to $14.

Companies.Name: MarineQuest Summer Instructor 2024
Companies.LinkedIn: Not Relevant, can't apply through LinkedIn.

Companies.Name: Amotions, Inc.
Companies.Contact: pianpian@amotionsinc.com (Pianpian Xu Guthrie is her full name, she's the CEO)
Companies.Tips: I'd write you a letter of recommendation and send Pianpian your resume if you want.
Companies.Pay: This is an unpaid, remote internship. You can use it to get credit for CSC 498 (See the "Recommendations" page in the "Classes" tab for more info)

Companies.Name: Cisco
Companies.Tips: Apply here for full-time jobs after you gain some experience through your internships.

Companies.Name: IBM
Companies.Contact: Me. Use the (contact form)[/ContactMe] to express interest.
Companies.Tips: Apply here for full-time jobs after you gain some experience through your internships.

Companies.Name: Lenovo
Companies.Tips: I'm kind of friends with a hiring manager at Lenovo, which could be another contact. He might be able to write you a letter of recommendation. While that might help you slightly if you get an interview, I seriously wouldn't rely on that. I'll contact him if you want.

Companies.Name: Bank of America
Companies.Tips: I think the name of the SWE internship is "Global Technology Analyst" or "Technology Analyst". You can send your resume, job title and requisition to the email above.

Companies.Name: Lenovo LASR Program
Companies.Tips: This is NOT a software engineering position. It seems to be a popular technology sales program. I put it here in case that's something you're interested in. I know a couple people from Weddington who did this program.
